_header: Salue with all obeisance to God in humblesse
Subjects: Virgin Mary, hymns to; hymns, to Virgin Mary
_description: Prayer to the Virgin, in which first words of each line are the Latin words of a prayer to the Virgin (read down the left edges of lines); 5 eight-line stanzas

BodRawC48.First Lines:
Salue wyth all obaysans to god in humblesseRegina to regne euermore
                    in blys…
BodRawC48.Last Lines:
…Nobis post hoc exilium ostendeTo oure eterne grettest Ioy
                    & plesure
BodRawC48.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “Lydgatiana.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         131 (1913): 40-63: 44-5.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Salue wyth all obeysance to God in
                        humblesseRegina to regne ever more in blysse…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Mater of lyffe & eterne creacionSalue ever
                    as fayer as we can suffyce Amen
OxfBal354.Attributed Title: An holy salue regina In englisshe (p. 340)
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

Flügel,  Ewald. 
             “Liedersammlungen des XVI Jahrhunderts….” 
             Anglia
         26 (1903): 94-285: 172-3.
Dyboski,  R.,
                        ed.  
             Songs, Carols and Other Miscellaneous Poems from Balliol MS. 354,

EETS
